<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 18pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><A NAME="lapab001"></A>A Year of Compensation Action</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Our pay story in 2014 is one of unwavering alignment to our compensation
principles despite our performance shortfalls-we recognize we have performed poorly relative to our peers. But our pay story has
another chapter as well: compensation is a key tool we use to compete with our peers for talent that can realize top value from
our exceptional assets and sound strategy.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">Due to the recent changes we made to our compensation program:</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 99%; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 10pt"><FONT STYLE="color: rgb(199,153,0)">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify">Our former CEO, who retired in 2015, received no increase in base pay in the years 2010-2014.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: rgb(199,153,0)">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt">His performance-based equity awards increased from an average of 32 percent of his total equity awards in 2011-2012 to 59 percent
of his total equity awards in 2013-2014.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: rgb(199,153,0)">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt">His average reported compensation for the years 2013-2014 was 35 percent lower than his average reported compensation for 2011-2012.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: rgb(199,153,0)">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt">His realized pay dropped even more-it was:</TD></TR>                                                             <TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: rgb(199,153,0)">&nbsp;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: rgb(199,153,0)">&ndash;
                                         </FONT>down 66 percent from his reported 2010 pay,</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: rgb(199,153,0)">&nbsp;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: rgb(199,153,0)">&ndash;
                                         </FONT>down 41 percent from his reported 2011 pay, and</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: rgb(199,153,0)">&nbsp;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: rgb(199,153,0)">&ndash;
                                         </FONT>down 34 percent from his reported 2012 pay.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="padding-top: 9pt">The other updates we made to our 2014 pay plans share the same theme:</TD></TR>

<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: rgb(199,153,0)">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt">Our annual cash incentive bonus plan is better aligned with corporate strategy.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: rgb(199,153,0)">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt">We increased the target percentage of 2014 equity awards that are performance-based to 67 percent for the CEO and 50 percent
for the other NEOs.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: rgb(199,153,0)">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt">We improved our TSR share program by limiting the maximum payout to target for performance periods in which our absolute TSR
was negative and setting target achievement above median performance of our peer group.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: rgb(199,153,0)">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt">We suspended the granting of stock options.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: rgb(199,153,0)">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt">Our new business performance share plan is based on business results.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: rgb(199,153,0)">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt">Effective July 1, 2014, we increased the percentage of our directors&rsquo; annual retainer payable in stock to two-thirds
and now require that such stock be held until directors leave the board.</TD></TR></TABLE>

<P STYLE="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Through regular engagement with our shareholders, we continue
to look for ways to make our compensation programs the best they can be. The feedback we received from our shareholders led to
our making numerous changes to our pay and governance provisions over the last two years, resulting in a 96 percent say on pay
approval vote in 2014.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: right"><B>APACHE CORPORATION</B> <I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>29</B></P>


    <DIV STYLE="margin-bottom: 6pt; border-bottom: Silver 4px solid"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: center; width: 100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
    <DIV STYLE="page-break-before: always; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 10pt"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: bold 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: left; width: 50%"><A HREF="#toc">Back to Contents</A></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: right; width: 50%"><PAGE></PAGE></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>


<P STYLE="font: 18pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">A Year of Strategic Action</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">We accomplished these compensation actions in a year already
full of change. We continued our transition to becoming a premier North American onshore resource E&amp;P company through strategic
divestment of material non-core assets, driving down costs, drilling more productive wells, and continuing to mature several resource
plays. In 2014, we repurchased 21.0 million of our shares, reducing our share count by 5.3 percent, and in early 2015, we reduced
our employee base by approximately 5 percent to better align with our reduced asset base.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Finally, we completed a multi-year succession-planning process
with the retirement, in January 2015, of our long-serving CEO, G. Steven Farris, and the appointment of long-time Apache employee,
John J. Christmann, IV, formerly executive vice president and chief operating officer-North America, as CEO. Consistent with good
governance principles, we incorporated into this transition the appointment of a separate board chair, initially Mr. Farris until
he retires from the board on May 1, 2015, and then independent director John E. Lowe.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 18pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 18pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><A NAME="lapab002"></A>A Year of Building on Pay Best Practices</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">We continued to add to or improve on our compensation best practices,
including:</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 99%; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 10pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><I>Significant Performance-Based Pay: </I>Our performance-based equity compensation comprised 54 percent of our NEOs&rsquo;
aggregate equity compensation for fiscal year 2014.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt"><I>Long-term vesting: </I>Our equity-based pay vehicles have multi-year vesting periods to reward long-term performance and
deter inappropriate risk taking.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt"><I>Multiple Performance Measures: </I>We use multiple performance measures that include short- and long-term objectives to
evaluate executive performance.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt"><I>Stock Ownership Requirements: </I>We have stock ownership requirements for our directors and officers; Our CEO must hold
six times base salary in stock; All officers and directors have hold-until-retirement or termination requirements in addition to
their multiple-of-pay holding requirements.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt"><I>No Repricing: </I>Our stock options cannot be repriced, reset, or exchanged for cash if under water.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt"><I>Anti-Pledging Policy: </I>We prohibit our directors and executive officers from holding Apache securities in a margin account
or pledging any Apache securities as collateral for a loan.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt"><I>Double Trigger: </I>We continued and formalized our policy of requiring a double trigger for accelerated vesting of equity
upon a change in control.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt"><I>Clawback: </I>Each equity award is conditioned on repayment or forfeiture as required by existing law, including Sarbanes-Oxley
Act of 2002 and Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt"><I>No Gross-Ups: </I>We do not make tax gross-ups to executive officers except for (i) our expatriate tax-equalization policy,
which is available to all Apache expatriates, and (ii) tax gross ups of continuing certain group benefits like health insurance
upon a change in control pursuant to our Income Continuance Plan (which provides benefits to various categories of our employees
including our officers).</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt"><I>Employment Contracts: </I>Effective with the retirement of our former CEO, all of our employees are employed &ldquo;at will,&rdquo;
with no employment contracts.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt"><I>SVP of Communications, Public Affairs and Governance: </I>We have an executive charged with intensive engagement on non-financial
and non-operating issues important to our shareholders, including governance, environment, safety, and sustainability.</TD></TR></TABLE>


<P STYLE="font: 18pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 18pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><A NAME="lapab003"></A>Our Approach to Pay</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Our approach to compensation takes into account horizontal (market)
and vertical (internal) parity concerns as well as recruitment, retention, and long-term performance goals.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 14pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 14pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; border-bottom: rgb(199,153,0) 2px solid">Peer Groups and Data</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Peer group data contributes to our horizontal parity, recruitment,
retention and performance analysis. To assemble the right peer group, our MD&amp;C Committee uses eight criteria, ranked in the
following order:</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; width: 99%"><TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-align: justify">
<TD STYLE="width: 18pt; text-align: left; color: rgb(199,153,0)">1.</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify">Industry: companies with our 6-digit GICS code (101020 &ndash; Oil, Gas and Consumable
Fuels)</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-align: justify">
<TD STYLE="text-align: left; color: rgb(199,153,0); padding-top: 3pt">2.</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt">Market Capitalization: companies +/-2.5x Apache&rsquo;s market cap</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-align: justify">
<TD STYLE="text-align: left; color: rgb(199,153,0); padding-top: 3pt">3.</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt">Revenues: companies +/-2.5x Apache&rsquo;s revenues</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-align: justify">
<TD STYLE="text-align: left; color: rgb(199,153,0); padding-top: 3pt">4.</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt">Assets: companies +/-2.5x Apache&rsquo;s assets</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-align: justify">
<TD STYLE="text-align: left; color: rgb(199,153,0); padding-top: 3pt">5.</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt">Domestic headquarters</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-align: justify">
<TD STYLE="text-align: left; color: rgb(199,153,0); padding-top: 3pt">6.</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt">Compete with Apache for talent</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-align: justify">
<TD STYLE="text-align: left; color: rgb(199,153,0); padding-top: 3pt">7.</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt">List Apache as a peer in their 2014 proxy statement</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-align: justify">
<TD STYLE="text-align: left; color: rgb(199,153,0); padding-top: 3pt">8.</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt">List a peer of Apache as a peer in their 2014 proxy statement</TD>
</TR></TABLE>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: right"><B>APACHE CORPORATION</B><I> - 2015 Proxy Statement&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I><B>30</B></P>


    <DIV STYLE="margin-bottom: 6pt; border-bottom: Silver 4px solid"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: center; width: 100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
    <DIV STYLE="page-break-before: always; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 10pt"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: bold 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: left; width: 50%"><A HREF="#toc">Back to Contents</A></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: right; width: 50%"><PAGE></PAGE></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>


<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Of the 11 peer companies Apache used in 2013, seven met all eight
criteria and the remaining four met at least five. Based on this, the MD&amp;C Committee decided to keep the same peer group for
2014:</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 99%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom">
    <TD STYLE="width: 100%; border: rgb(199,153,0) 2px solid; padding: 5pt; font-size: 9pt; background-color: rgb(244,235,204)"><FONT STYLE="font-size: 9pt">Anadarko Petroleum Corporation </FONT><BR>
<FONT STYLE="font-size: 9pt">Chesapeake Energy Corporation </FONT><BR>
<FONT STYLE="font-size: 9pt">ConocoPhillips Company </FONT><BR>
<FONT STYLE="font-size: 9pt">Devon Energy Corporation </FONT><BR>
<FONT STYLE="font-size: 9pt">EOG Resources, Inc.</FONT><BR>
<FONT STYLE="font-size: 9pt">Hess Corporation </FONT><BR>
<FONT STYLE="font-size: 9pt">Marathon Oil Company </FONT><BR>
<FONT STYLE="font-size: 9pt">Murphy Oil Corporation </FONT><BR>
<FONT STYLE="font-size: 9pt">Noble Energy, Inc.</FONT><BR>
<FONT STYLE="font-size: 9pt">Occidental Petroleum Corporation </FONT><BR>
<FONT STYLE="font-size: 9pt">Pioneer Natural Resources</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">We also relied on this Compensation Peer Group for our 2014 TSR
program. For earlier years&rsquo; TSR programs, we used a broader peer group.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Over the last few years, we also worked with some of our peers
as well as executives at the proxy advisory services to improve peer group reporting for our sector. As a result, starting this
year, the proxy advisory services will use a new approach that takes account of the unique features of E&amp;P companies. We consider
this a good example of constructive engagement.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">In addition to the Compensation Peer Group data, we use (i) the
most recent salary data provided by our Consultant (defined below) after reviewing its data-assimilation process, (ii) industry
size-based surveys, (iii) our own labor market data, and (iv) Fortune 500 proxy statement data on CEO pay for companies with similar
market capitalizations.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">The MD&amp;C Committee also assesses other types of horizontal
data as well as numerous vertical assessments as input into each of our four main elements of pay: base salary, annual bonus, long-term
compensation and benefits.</P>



<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; color: rgb(199,153,0)">Careful Use of Discretion</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">The Board and the MD&amp;C Committee recognize that some shareholders
are concerned that boards tend to use discretion in executives&rsquo; favor. However, most shareholders recognize that there are
also dangers in relying purely on formulae and that business judgment plays an important role in compensation decisions. We are
judicious in our use of discretion. No NEO received an exceptional adjustment for 2014.</P>


<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; color: rgb(199,153,0)">Reported Pay vs Realized Pay</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">We not only consider the value of our
NEOs&rsquo; compensation when it is granted, but also when realized, as we believe that it is important that the amount they
eventually take home correlates with our shareholders&rsquo; returns. We have intentionally designed our compensation program
so that a large portion of our NEOs&rsquo; realized compensation directly aligns with our shareholders&rsquo; returns.
Therefore, a substantial percentage of their compensation is long-term and equity-based, the realized value of which will be
determined by the future long-term performance of our common stock on both a relative and absolute basis. While we appreciate
that various methods can be utilized to calculate realized pay, we think it makes the most sense to compare the pay as
reported in the total compensation column of our Summary Compensation Table and the amount of that reported pay that the
executive actually took home or is realizable as of a future measurement date.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">As an example and as noted above, due to our performance shortfalls
over the last few years, through December 31, 2014, our former CEO realized only 66 percent of his reported 2010 pay, 41 percent
of his reported 2011 pay, and 34 percent of his reported 2012 pay.<SUP>1</SUP></P>

<P STYLE="font: 18pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 18pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><A NAME="lapab004"></A>2014 Compensation</P>

<P STYLE="font: 14pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 14pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; border-bottom: rgb(199,153,0) 2px solid"><A NAME="lapab005"></A>Base
Salary</P>

<P STYLE="font: 14pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Our ability to recruit and retain executive talent depends on
setting competitive base salaries. We begin with an analysis of base pay relative to the market. We make adjustments based on vertical
variables such as an executive&rsquo;s role and length of service to the Company, pay parity relative to other officers and internal
accountability. We review base salaries annually as a whole and individually every 12 to 18 months, unless circumstances require
otherwise. For non-CEO NEO salaries, we solicit CEO input.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Mr. Farris&rsquo; base salary for 2014 was $1,750,000. Mr. Farris,
who retired on January 20, 2015, has not received an increase in his base salary since January 1, 2010. In connection with his
retirement, Mr. Farris entered into an Executive Retirement Agreement. See footnote 1 to the table under &ldquo;Potential Payments
Upon Termination or Change in Control&rdquo; for discussion of the Executive Retirement Agreement.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<!-- Field: Rule-Page --><DIV ALIGN="LEFT"><DIV STYLE="font-size: 1pt; border-top: rgb(199,153,0) 1px solid; width: 20%">&nbsp;</DIV></DIV><!-- Field: /Rule-Page -->

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"></P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; width: 99%"><TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-align: justify">
<TD STYLE="width: 5pt; text-align: right"><FONT STYLE="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><SUP>1</SUP></FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><FONT STYLE="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">Realized
                                         Pay for each year defined as:</FONT></TD>
</TR></TABLE>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0; margin-bottom: 0; width: 99%"><TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
<TD STYLE="width: 10pt; text-align: right; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"></TD><TD STYLE="width: 5pt; color: rgb(199,153,0); font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&ndash;</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">Actual salary and bonus paid;</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
<TD STYLE="text-align: right; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="color: rgb(199,153,0); font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&ndash;</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">RSUs and TSRs valued at December 31, 2014 stock price of $62.67, whether or not vested;</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
<TD STYLE="text-align: right; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="color: rgb(199,153,0); font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&ndash;</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">Stock options valued using Black-Scholes as of December 31, 2014 ($5.85 for 2010 options,
$4.06 for 2011 options, $10.98 for 2012 options) whether or not vested; plus</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
<TD STYLE="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"></TD><TD STYLE="color: rgb(199,153,0); font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&ndash;</TD><TD STYLE="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">Other Compensation as shown in the Summary Compensation table.</TD></TR></TABLE>

<P STYLE="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: right"><B>APACHE CORPORATION</B> <I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>31</B></P>


    <DIV STYLE="margin-bottom: 6pt; border-bottom: Silver 4px solid"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: center; width: 100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
    <DIV STYLE="page-break-before: always; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 10pt"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: bold 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: left; width: 50%"><A HREF="#toc">Back to Contents</A></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: right; width: 50%"><PAGE></PAGE></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>


<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">On January 1, 2014, Mr. Christmann and Mr. Voytovich were promoted
to executive vice president and chief operating officer of North America and international operations, respectively. This resulted
in a base salary increase from $550,000 to $725,000 for Mr. Christmann, and from $675,000 to $725,000 for Mr. Voytovich. On January
1, 2014, Mr. Bahorich received a base salary increase from $650,000 to $700,000 and on May 16, 2014, Mr. Lannie received an increase
from $650,000 to $675,000.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Mr. Johnston was promoted to executive vice president and region
vice president of our central region effective January 1, 2014 and received a base salary increase from $500,000 to $550,000; his
employment with the Company ended on July 31, 2014. Mr. Leon was promoted to executive vice president and chief financial officer
in February 2014 with a salary increase from $525,000 to $705,000; his employment with the Company ended on October 9, 2014. The
base salaries for Messrs. Plank, $900,000, and Chambers, $600,000, remained unchanged in 2014. Mr. Plank&rsquo;s employment with
the Company ended on March 31, 2014, and Mr. Chambers&rsquo; employment with the Company ended on August 31, 2014.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 14pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 14pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; border-bottom: rgb(199,153,0) 2px solid"><A NAME="lapab006"></A>Annual
Cash Incentive Bonus</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">We set annual cash incentive bonus targets hierarchically starting
with a multiple of base salary. Actual annual bonus payouts are based on our achievement of a variety of financial, operational
and management objectives (&ldquo;the corporate performance element&rdquo;), each officer&rsquo;s individual achievement (&ldquo;the
individual performance element&rdquo;), and any needed exceptional adjustments.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; color: rgb(199,153,0)">Corporate Performance Element</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">The corporate performance element consists of corporate objectives&ndash;weighted
70 percent&ndash;and management objectives&ndash;weighted 30 percent.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; color: rgb(199,153,0)">Corporate Objectives</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Executive officers can receive partial, full or extra credit
on each of the corporate objectives, which are key corporate operational and financial objectives. In 2014, they were:</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 99%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; background-color: rgb(242,213,177)">
    <TD COLSPAN="3" STYLE="padding-left: 3pt; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: left; vertical-align: top; border-bottom: Black 2px solid; background-color: rgb(242,213,177); padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt"><B>Corporate Objectives - 2014 Corporate
    Goals</B></TD>
    <TD STYLE="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; border-bottom: Black 2px solid; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt"><B>Weighting</B></TD>
    <TD STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: left; vertical-align: top; border-bottom: Black 2px solid; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: left; vertical-align: top; border-bottom: Black 2px solid; padding-right: 2pt; padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt"><B>Result</B></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
    <TD COLSPAN="3" STYLE="padding-left: 3pt; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: left; vertical-align: top; border-bottom: Black 1px solid; background-color: rgb(217,217,217); padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt"><B>Operational Goals</B> </TD>
    <TD STYLE="text-align: right; vertical-align: top; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; border-bottom: Black 1px solid; background-color: rgb(217,217,217); padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: left; vertical-align: top; border-bottom: Black 1px solid; background-color: rgb(217,217,217); padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: left; vertical-align: top; border-bottom: Black 1px solid; padding-right: 2pt; background-color: rgb(217,217,217); padding-top: 2pt; padding-bottom: 2pt">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
    <TD STYLE="text-align: left; vertical-align: top; padding-left: 3pt; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; padding-top: 2pt"><B>1.</B></TD>
    <TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: left; vertical-align: top; padding-top: 2pt"><B>Proforma Production Growth Per Share of 5%</B></TD>

    <TD STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: left; vertical-align: top; padding-right: 2pt; padding-top: 2pt">Achieved proforma production growth per share of 11.7%</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">

    <TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: left; vertical-align: top; background-color: rgb(248,241,221); padding-top: 2pt"><B>Replace 115% of 2014 production through E&amp;D adds</B></TD>

    <TD STYLE="width: 45%; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: left; vertical-align: top; background-color: rgb(248,241,221); padding-top: 2pt">$10.82 LOE per BOE</TD>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">After the corporate objectives and modifiers are calculated,
a final modifier of 72.9 was applied, based on the absolute performance of our stock price over a one-year period. This process
yielded an actual total of 94.8 points.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: right"><B>APACHE CORPORATION</B><I> - 2015 Proxy Statement&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I><B>32</B></P>



    <DIV STYLE="margin-bottom: 6pt; border-bottom: Silver 4px solid"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: center; width: 100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
    <DIV STYLE="page-break-before: always; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 10pt"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: bold 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: left; width: 50%"><A HREF="#toc">Back to Contents</A></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: right; width: 50%"><PAGE></PAGE></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>


<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; color: rgb(199,153,0)">Management Objectives</P>

<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Our management objectives are a robust set of strategic
and tactical goals developed and weighted by management and assessed and approved by the MD&amp;C Committee. In essence, the
management objectives are a lengthy to-do list for each of our regions and corporate departments. Each of the 47 objectives
for 2014 represents no more than one percent of an officer&rsquo;s annual cash incentive bonus. The MD&amp;C Committee can
award partial or extra credit for an existing management objective, as well as credit for extraordinary objectives when
warranted. Three extraordinary objectives were achieved in 2014.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">We achieved 124.5 percent of the 2014 management objectives.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">The aggregate achievement of the corporate performance element
was 103.7 percent, calculated as shown below:</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="border-collapse: collapse; width: 99%; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom">
    <TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; padding-left: 2pt; background-color: rgb(242,213,177); border-bottom: Black 2px solid">Goal</TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; background-color: rgb(242,213,177); border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: left; background-color: rgb(242,213,177); border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: right; background-color: rgb(242,213,177); border-bottom: Black 2px solid"><FONT STYLE="font-size: 9pt"><B>Results<BR>
(%)</B></FONT></TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: left; background-color: rgb(242,213,177); border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; background-color: rgb(242,213,177); border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: left; background-color: rgb(242,213,177); border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: right; background-color: rgb(242,213,177); border-bottom: Black 2px solid"><FONT STYLE="font-size: 9pt"><B>Weighting<BR>
(%)</B></FONT></TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: left; background-color: rgb(242,213,177); border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; background-color: rgb(242,213,177); border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: left; background-color: rgb(242,213,177); border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: right; background-color: rgb(242,213,177); border-bottom: Black 2px solid"><FONT STYLE="font-size: 9pt"><B>Total<BR>
(%)</B></FONT></TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: left; background-color: rgb(242,213,177); border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom">
    <TD STYLE="width: 46%; text-align: left; padding-left: 2pt; background-color: rgb(248,241,221)">Corporate Objectives</TD><TD STYLE="width: 8%; background-color: rgb(248,241,221)">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 1%; text-align: left; background-color: rgb(248,241,221)">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="width: 8%; text-align: right; background-color: rgb(248,241,221)">94.8</TD><TD STYLE="width: 1%; text-align: left; background-color: rgb(248,241,221)">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="width: 8%; background-color: rgb(248,241,221)">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 1%; text-align: left; background-color: rgb(248,241,221)">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="width: 8%; text-align: right; background-color: rgb(248,241,221)">70</TD><TD STYLE="width: 1%; text-align: left; background-color: rgb(248,241,221)">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="width: 8%; background-color: rgb(248,241,221)">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 1%; text-align: left; background-color: rgb(248,241,221)">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="width: 8%; text-align: right; background-color: rgb(248,241,221)">66.4</TD><TD STYLE="width: 1%; text-align: left; background-color: rgb(248,241,221)">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom">
    <TD STYLE="text-align: left; padding-left: 2pt; border-bottom: Black 2px solid">Management Objectives</TD><TD STYLE="border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="text-align: left; border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 2px solid">124.5</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: left; border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: left; padding-left: 2pt; background-color: rgb(248,241,221); border-bottom: Black 2px solid">Total 2014 Achievement</TD><TD STYLE="background-color: rgb(248,241,221); border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="text-align: left; background-color: rgb(248,241,221); border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: right; background-color: rgb(248,241,221); border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: left; background-color: rgb(248,241,221); border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="background-color: rgb(248,241,221); border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="text-align: left; background-color: rgb(248,241,221); border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: right; background-color: rgb(248,241,221); border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="text-align: left; background-color: rgb(248,241,221); border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; background-color: rgb(248,241,221); border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD>

</TABLE>

<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; color: rgb(199,153,0)">Individual Performance Element</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Using the corporate and management objectives as a foundation,
the MD&amp;C Committee takes input from the CEO, checks the bonus numbers against market data, and, where needed, further tailors
annual cash incesntive bonuses to the responsibilities and performance of each executive. Our CEO evaluates region officers based
on region goals and performance as part of those officers&rsquo; bonus assessment.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; color: rgb(199,153,0)">Annual Incentive Bonuses Awarded for
2014</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Despite our significant accomplishments transitioning the Company
in a year of challenging commodity prices, our stock price has trailed our peers. We have chosen our path, despite its immediate-term
costs, to position us for the future. Given this overall picture, the MD&amp;C Committee accepted management&rsquo;s recommendation
that a payment of annual bonuses at 103.7 percent of target, which included the impact of a stock price modifier, was too high,
particularly for senior management. After consideration of the recent decline in oil prices and our stock price performance relative
to our peers over the last few years, the MD&amp;C Committee determined that a bonus payout lower than target was appropriate for
our employees including our NEOs. The bonuses awarded to the NEOs for 2014 were:</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="border-collapse: collapse; width: 99%; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom">
    <TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; border-bottom: Black 2px solid; padding-left: 2pt; background-color: rgb(242,213,177)">Name</TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; background-color: rgb(242,213,177); border-bottom: Black 2px solid">&nbsp;</TD>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Messrs. Farris, Leon, Plank, Johnston and Chambers did not receive
a bonus for 2014, as they were not employed by the Company at the time of the bonus payout.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 14pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 14pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; border-bottom: rgb(199,153,0) 2px solid"><A NAME="lapab007"></A>Long
Term Compensation</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">We make long-term, equity-based compensation available to substantially
all of our employees to promote a company-wide ethic of ownership and entrepreneurialism. For our executive officers, we use a
number of equity-based vehicles&ndash;RSUs, TSR shares, and Performance Shares&ndash;to capture the merits and spread the shortcomings of each
pay vehicle.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">At the beginning of 2014, we apportioned Mr. Farris&rsquo; long-term
compensation in equal thirds between TSR Shares, Performance Shares (defined below), and RSUs. The other NEOs received 25 percent
as TSR Shares, 25 percent as Performance Shares, and 50 percent as RSUs.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>


<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="width: 20%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
    <TD STYLE="width: 50%; font: 11pt/115% Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; text-align: center"><IMG SRC="lapax33x1.jpg" ALT=""></TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 50%; font: 11pt/115% Calibri, Helvetica, Sans-Serif; text-align: center; padding-left: 150pt"><IMG SRC="lapax33x2.jpg" ALT=""></TD>
    </tr>
</TABLE>



<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>


<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">Performance based equity is comprised of TSR and Performance
shares.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: right"><B>APACHE CORPORATION</B> <I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>33</B></P>


    <DIV STYLE="margin-bottom: 6pt; border-bottom: Silver 4px solid"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: center; width: 100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
    <DIV STYLE="page-break-before: always; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 10pt"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: bold 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: left; width: 50%"><A HREF="#toc">Back to Contents</A></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: right; width: 50%"><PAGE></PAGE></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>


<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; color: rgb(199,153,0)">TSR Shares</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">To keep focus on total shareholder return, we grant executive
officers TSR shares. These shares target a percentage of base salary; are tied to our performance relative to our peers over rolling
three-year periods; vest (if achievement warrants and the executive is still with the Company) in two even portions at the end
of the measuring period and the subsequent year; and for the 2014 TSR program graded down in units of 0.2 from two-times payout
for being the top performance to no payout for being in the bottom quartile. Also, there is a cap at target payout (one-times payout)
in the event absolute TSR for Apache is negative over the performance
period, notwithstanding the relative performance of the shares. The shares are subject to similar double-trigger requirements as
our other change in control provisions.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">The performance period for the 2012 TSR Program began on January
1, 2012, and ended on December 31, 2014. Apache was ranked in the bottom 25 percent of its peer group, resulting in a zero payout
and the cancellation and forfeiture of the grants under this program for all eligible employees. The 2011 and 2010 TSR Plans also
yielded a zero payout.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; color: rgb(199,153,0); text-align: justify">Performance Shares</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">In February 2014, our NEOs received shares
under our 2014 Performance Program (&ldquo;Performance Shares&rdquo;). This program was designed to align executive pay with achievement
of operational, financial, health, safety, and environmental metrics that are the most impactful to the Company. The initial shares
granted in 2014 are based on a percentage of base salary; use the operational metrics outlined in our 2014 annual incentive bonus
plan to measure performance; and use a one-year measurement period for 2014. The performance period for the 2014 Performance Program
began on January 1, 2014, and ended on December 31, 2014. The program yielded a payout of 122.7 percent of target. The shares
vest on the second and third anniversary of the measuring period end date and have the same employment-for-vesting and change-in-control
provisions as our TSR shares.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; color: rgb(199,153,0); text-align: justify">Restricted Stock
Units</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Our employees, including our NEOs, also receive RSUs. Generally,
the RSUs are granted to substantially all employees based on a target percentage of base salary; vest ratably over three or four
years; upon vesting, allow each grantee to receive one share of common stock for each RSU; and require a double trigger for accelerated
vesting (both a change in control and a recipient&rsquo;s involuntary termination or voluntary termination with cause).</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">The number and value of the RSUs, TSR Shares, and Performance
Shares we granted to our NEOs in 2014 are captured in the following chart:</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="border-collapse: collapse; width: 99%; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom">
    <TD STYLE="text-align: center; padding-left: 2pt; background-color: rgb(242,213,177); padding-bottom: 2px">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: center; background-color: rgb(242,213,177); padding-bottom: 2px">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD COLSPAN="7" STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: center; background-color: rgb(242,213,177); border-bottom: Black 2px solid"><FONT STYLE="font-size: 9pt"><B>TSR Shares</B></FONT></TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: center; background-color: rgb(242,213,177); padding-bottom: 2px">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD COLSPAN="7" STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: center; background-color: rgb(242,213,177); border-bottom: Black 2px solid"><FONT STYLE="font-size: 9pt"><B>Performance Shares</B></FONT></TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: center; background-color: rgb(242,213,177); padding-bottom: 2px">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: left; border-bottom: Black 2px solid; background-color: rgb(242,213,177)">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 2px solid; background-color: rgb(242,213,177)"><FONT STYLE="font-size: 9pt"><B>($)</B></FONT></TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: left; border-bottom: Black 2px solid; background-color: rgb(242,213,177)">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; border-bottom: Black 2px solid; background-color: rgb(242,213,177)">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: left; border-bottom: Black 2px solid; background-color: rgb(242,213,177)">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 2px solid; background-color: rgb(242,213,177)"><FONT STYLE="font-size: 9pt"><B>(#)</B></FONT></TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: left; border-bottom: Black 2px solid; background-color: rgb(242,213,177)">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; border-bottom: Black 2px solid; background-color: rgb(242,213,177)">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: left; border-bottom: Black 2px solid; background-color: rgb(242,213,177)">&nbsp;</TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 2px solid; background-color: rgb(242,213,177)"><FONT STYLE="font-size: 9pt"><B>($)</B></FONT></TD><TD STYLE="font-weight: bold; text-align: left; border-bottom: Black 2px solid; background-color: rgb(242,213,177)">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(248,241,221)">

of Plan-Based Awards table.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Note that the targeted grant date values of long-term compensation
and the actual grant date values shown in these tables vary somewhat due to the prospective nature of targets. The amounts that
will be realized by the NEOs from these awards may differ substantially from the grant date values.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 18pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 18pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><A NAME="lapab008"></A>Compensation for New CEO</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">On February 19, 2015, the MD&amp;C Committee recommended, and
the Board approved, the following changes to Mr. Christmann&rsquo;s compensation in connection with his promotion to president
and CEO:</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 99%; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 10pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify"><I>Base Salary </I>&ndash; Increased from $725,000 to $1,100,000, effective January 20, 2015 (date of appointment).</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt; text-align: justify"><I>Target Bonus </I>&ndash; Increased from 100 percent to 130 percent of base salary.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt; text-align: justify"><I>Long-Term Compensation </I>&ndash; Eligible for 2015 program (60 percent of target annual awards will be comprised of performance
shares).</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt; text-align: justify"><I>Promotional Award </I>&ndash; One-time award of 50,000 restricted stock units was made on February 18, 2015. He is required
to hold 60 percent of the RSUs that vest each year until retirement or termination.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt; text-align: justify"><I>Change in Control Termination Provisions </I>&ndash; Multiple of base salary plus bonus was increased from two to three
times in the event of a termination upon a change in control under the Company&rsquo;s Income Continuance Plan.</TD></TR></TABLE>

<P STYLE="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: right"><B>APACHE CORPORATION</B><I> - 2015 Proxy Statement&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I><B>34</B></P>


    <DIV STYLE="margin-bottom: 6pt; border-bottom: Silver 4px solid"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: center; width: 100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
    <DIV STYLE="page-break-before: always; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 10pt"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: bold 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: left; width: 50%"><A HREF="#toc">Back to Contents</A></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: right; width: 50%"><PAGE></PAGE></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>


<P STYLE="font: 18pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><A NAME="lapab009"></A>Decision Making Process</P>

<P STYLE="font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 14pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; border-bottom: rgb(199,153,0) 2px solid">Role of the Board
of Directors</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Executive compensation decision making is a core Board responsibility.
The independent members of the Board review, modify as needed, and approve the MD&amp;C Committee&rsquo;s recommendations for the
CEO&rsquo;s total compensation. The entire Board is responsible for this same process in establishing the other NEOs&rsquo; compensation.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 14pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 14pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; border-bottom: rgb(199,153,0) 2px solid">Role of the Management
Development and Compensation Committee</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">The MD&amp;C Committee, which met five times in 2014, assesses
the effectiveness of our compensation programs. Its key responsibilities are:</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 99%; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 10pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify">To review our goals and objectives, evaluate performance in light of such goals, and recommend the CEO&rsquo;s compensation
to the Board for approval by the independent directors. This review is handled in independent sessions.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt; text-align: justify">To make recommendations to the Board concerning the base salary, incentive and equity-based compensation plans for executive
officers other than the CEO.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt; text-align: justify">To review and recommend to the Board broad-based, long-term compensation programs for executive and non-executive employees.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt; text-align: justify">To ensure compensation does not incentivize excessive risk.</TD></TR></TABLE>

<P STYLE="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Each of the MD&amp;C Committee&rsquo;s four members meets the
independence requirements of the New York Stock Exchange and the NASDAQ listing standards. The MD&amp;C Committee&rsquo;s charter
is available on our website.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 14pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; border-bottom: rgb(199,153,0) 2px solid">Role of the Stock
Plan Committee</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">The key responsibilities of the Stock Plan Committee, which met
six times in 2014, are:</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 99%; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 10pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify">Administration of our equity-based compensation plans and the approval, award, and administration of grants under the same,
including certification of performance goals and their achievement.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt">Make recommendations to the Board regarding our equity-based compensation plans.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt">Prepare a summary of the grants and awards made under our equity-based compensation plans and programs for the MD&amp;C Committee
for use in our proxy statement.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify; padding-top: 3pt">Any other duties or responsibilities expressly delegated to the Stock Plan Committee by the Board relating to our equity-based
compensation plans and programs.</TD></TR></TABLE>

<P STYLE="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Each member of the Stock Plan Committee meets the independence
requirements of the New York Stock Exchange and NASDAQ listing standards and is an outside director within the meaning of Section
162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code. The Stock Plan Committee&rsquo;s charter is available on our website.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 14pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 14pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; border-bottom: rgb(199,153,0) 2px solid">Role of the Compensation
Consultant</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">The Board has authorized the MD&amp;C Committee to retain an
independent compensation consultant. The MD&amp;C Committee engaged Meridian Compensation Partners (the &ldquo;Consultant&rdquo;)
to provide independent compensation advice and data. The Consultant annually assesses our compensation program&rsquo;s potential
for risk and its competitiveness relative to our peers. Except for limited work for management in connection with the Consultant&rsquo;s
published industry-specific surveys, for which the Consultant received <I>de minimis </I>compensation, the Consultant did not provide
any services to Apache other than the compensation-related services to the Board.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Each year the MD&amp;C Committee reviews the independence of
the Consultant and obtains written certification that the Consultant complies with its own independence rules. The MD&amp;C Committee
determined that the Consultant was independent in 2014.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 14pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 14pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; border-bottom: rgb(199,153,0) 2px solid">Role of Management</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">In addition to the use of the Consultant,
the MD&amp;C Committee receives compensation recommendations and evaluations of the executive group from the CEO. The MD&amp;C
Committee, along with each of the independent directors, is authorized by the Board to obtain information from and work directly
with any employee in fulfilling its responsibilities. Our executive vice president of human resources prepares materials for the
CEO and the MD&amp;C Committee for the exercise of their distinct, but interrelated, compensation responsibilities. The MD&amp;C
Committee also utilizes the data provided by the Consultant, including recommendations for the associated compensation values
derived from their reports. The MD&amp;C Committee carefully considers the recommendations of the CEO, management, and the Consultant,
reaches final determinations, and recommends actions to the Board.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: right"><B>APACHE CORPORATION</B> <I>- 2015 Proxy Statement</I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B>35</B></P>




    <DIV STYLE="margin-bottom: 6pt; border-bottom: Silver 4px solid"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: center; width: 100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>
    <DIV STYLE="page-break-before: always; margin-top: 6pt; margin-bottom: 10pt"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: bold 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: left; width: 50%"><A HREF="#toc">Back to Contents</A></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: right; width: 50%"><PAGE></PAGE></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>


<P STYLE="font: 18pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><A NAME="lapab010"></A>Risk Considerations in Our Compensation
Programs</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">The MD&amp;C Committee does not believe our compensation programs
encourage inappropriate risk taking. The MD&amp;C Committee, with assistance from the Consultant, arrived at this conclusion for
the following reasons:</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 99%; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt"><TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="width: 10pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="text-align: justify">Our employees receive both fixed and variable compensation. The fixed portion provides a steady income regardless of the Company&rsquo;s
stock performance. This allows executives to focus on the Company&rsquo;s business without an excessive focus on the Company&rsquo;s
stock price performance.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt; text-align: justify">The goals and objectives for the annual cash incentive bonus are set to avoid overweighting any single factor that, if not
achieved, would result in the loss of a large percentage of compensation.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt; text-align: justify">Our equity awards for executives generally vest over three to five year periods, which discourages short-term risk taking.
Our substantial equity holding requirements extend these time frames further.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt; text-align: justify">Our equity ownership requirements encourage a long-term perspective by our executives.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt; text-align: justify">Our equity compensation plan provides that our executives&rsquo; unvested long-term equity compensation is forfeited upon voluntary
termination.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt; text-align: justify">Our incentive programs have been in place for many years, and we have seen no evidence that they encourage excessive risk taking.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top">
<TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt"><FONT STYLE="color: #C79900">&bull;</FONT></TD><TD STYLE="padding-top: 3pt; text-align: justify">Essentially all of our employees participate in our equity-based compensation programs, regardless of business unit, which
encourages consistent behavior across the Company.</TD></TR></TABLE>

<P STYLE="margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font: 18pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 18pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><A NAME="lapab011"></A>Tax Legislation Related to Compensation</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended,
imposes a limit, with certain exceptions, on the amount that a publicly held corporation may deduct in any tax year commencing
on or after January 1, 1994, for the compensation paid or accrued to its chief executive officer and three highest compensated
officers (other than the principal executive officer or the principal financial officer). The MD&amp;C Committee periodically reviews
our compensation plans based upon these regulations to determine what further actions or changes, if any, would be appropriate.
The MD&amp;C Committee intends to seek shareholder approval for future stock-based compensation plans so that they may qualify
for the performance-based compensation exemption.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Our 2005 Stock Option Plan, 2007 Omnibus Equity Compensation
Plan (including the 2011 TSR Program), and 2011 Omnibus Equity Compensation Plan (including the 2012, 2013, and 2014 TSR Programs)
were approved by our shareholders and grants made under such plans qualify as &ldquo;performance-based&rdquo; under the regulations.
Our existing annual cash incentive compensation plan, special achievement bonuses, and 2000 Stock Option Plan do not meet the requirements
of the regulations, as the shareholder approvals necessary for exemption were not sought. However, these plans operate similarly
to prior or other existing plans and are designed to reward the contribution and performance of employees and to provide a meaningful
incentive for achieving Apache&rsquo;s goals, which in turn enhances shareholder value. No further grants can be made under the
2000 and 2005 Stock Option Plans, or the 2007 Omnibus Equity Compensation Plan. While the MD&amp;C Committee cannot predict how
our compensation policies may be further affected by this limitation, it is anticipated that executive compensation paid or accrued
pursuant to our compensation plans that have not met the requirements of the regulations will not result in any material loss of
tax deductions in the foreseeable future.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">Internal Revenue Code section 409A requires &ldquo;nonqualified
deferred compensation plans&rdquo; to meet requirements in order to avoid acceleration of the recipient&rsquo;s federal income
taxation of the deferred compensation. The Internal Revenue Service issued final regulations in April 2007 regarding the application
of Section 409A, which were generally effective January 1, 2009. Prior to effectiveness, companies were expected to comply in &ldquo;good
faith&rdquo; with the statute, taking note of the interim guidance issued by the Internal Revenue Service. We amended several of
our benefit plans in order for them to be exempt from Section 409A, while we continue to provide benefits through several plans
that remain subject to Section 409A. The terms of these plans were amended before January 1, 2009, as necessary, and are intended
to meet the requirements of the final regulations.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 18pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 18pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0"><A NAME="lapaa026"></A>Management Development and Compensation
Committee Report</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify">The Management Development and Compensation Committee of the
Board of Directors of Apache Corporation reviewed and discussed with management the Compensation Discussion and Analysis set forth
above, and based upon such review and discussion, recommended to the Board of Directors that the Compensation Discussion and Analysis
be included in this proxy statement.</P>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0">&nbsp;</P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 99%; border-collapse: collapse">
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
    <TD STYLE="padding-left: 2pt; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 48%">March 3, 2015</TD>
    <TD STYLE="width: 52%; font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><B>Members of the Management Development and Compensation
    Committee</B></TD></TR>

<P STYLE="font: 9pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: right"><B>APACHE CORPORATION</B><I> - 2015 Proxy Statement&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</I><B>36</B></P>


    <DIV STYLE="margin-bottom: 6pt; border-bottom: Silver 4px solid"><TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="width: 100%; font: 12pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif"><TR><TD STYLE="text-align: center; width: 100%">&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE></DIV>

<TR STYLE="vertical-align: bottom; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
    <TD STYLE="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-indent: 0pt; padding-left: 10pt; background-color: rgb(242,213,177)">&nbsp;</TD>

<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
    <TD STYLE="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; width: 18pt; padding-left: 2pt">(1)</TD>
    <TD STYLE="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: justify">The NEOs, with the exception of Mr. Lannie in 2013,
    were not entitled to receive payments that would be characterized as bonus payments. Mr. Lannie received a one-time payment
    in connection with his work on the Company&rsquo;s divestiture transactions in 2013. See footnote (3) for payments under the
    Company&rsquo;s incentive compensation plan.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; font: 3pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
    <TD STYLE="font: 3pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; padding-left: 2pt">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD STYLE="font: 3pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: justify">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
    <TD STYLE="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; padding-left: 2pt">(2)</TD>
    <TD STYLE="font: 8pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; text-align: justify">Value of restricted stock unit and option awards
    made during the fiscal year based upon aggregate grant date fair value, determined in accordance with applicable FASB ASC
    Topic 718. The discussion of the assumptions used in calculating the aggregate grant date fair value of the RSU awards can
    be found in the footnotes to the Grants of Plan Based Awards Table below and in Note 10 of the Notes to Consolidated Financial
    Statements included in the Company&rsquo;s Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2014. For stock options, the estimated
    fair value is based upon principles of the Black-Scholes option pricing model. The Black-Scholes model utilizes numerous arbitrary
    assumptions about financial variables such as interest rates, stock price volatility and future dividend yield. The value
    of the restricted stock unit and option awards is expensed ratably over the term of the award.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; font: 3pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
    <TD STYLE="font: 3pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; padding-left: 2pt">&nbsp;</TD>

    to the Company&rsquo;s incentive compensation plan as described under &ldquo;Annual Cash Incentive Bonus&rdquo; in the Compensation
    Discussion and Analysis.</TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="vertical-align: top; font: 3pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif">
    <TD STYLE="font: 3pt Times New Roman, Times, Serif; padding-left: 2pt">&nbsp;</TD>

    Table are not included as they are not above-market or preferential earnings.</TD></TR>
